name: ADventure Lib
description: The shuffle button has been hit. All the objects and characters have been mixed up! Randomness threatens to overrun the kingdom, and nothing is what it appears to be! It is up to you to defeat the fire-breathing [kitten], save your beloved [toilet], and find the [potato] of legend!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 1.0 GHz Memory: 512 MB RAM Storage: 120 MB available space Additional Notes: The Object Manager (Workshop) requires Java 1.6+

reviews.review_text: Quirky parody/spoof of RPG point and click adventures that takes about as long as a lunch break to play. Not for everyone, definitely not for everyone. But if one likes MADLibs and that type of absurd humor then this game will provide hours of amusement. NOTE: In no way should this game be taken seriously.

ADventure Lib has an interesting concept, but its implemented poorly. It's the same 'story' each time you start a new game with the same 4 scenes except that there are different unhumorous replacements for characters or items. Things like a firebreathing broom or combining 2 or 3 unlikely items to make a spear. The so called humor in this game is just dumb, not one bit funny.

When I was a tyke I used to program mad libs in BASIC and many laughs were had.  This game is a similar thing. There's a basic storyline and a set of objects that get shuffled, then you go through the story that way. The game is very short right now, but it has workshop support and the dev is working on releasing a storyline editor for the next update.   Create lots of random things and new stories in which to see them out of place.  For $2 it's a fun toy. Check it out.
it tries to be funny, but it's not.

A fun little game, although the voices for the mixed up words get incredibly annoying very quickly. Takes about 3 minutes to play through once you've figured it out. Not much replay value except for getting the achievements. For less than $2, you get what you're paying for. I'd recommend it if there was more to it, but as it stands, not quite worth it.
